fairy_sparklers.name: Fairy Sparklers
fairy_sparklers.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

gnome_heads.name: Gnome Heads
gnome_heads.description: Even Grimble Crumble would enjoy these exploding gnomes.

sprite_lights.name: Sprite Lights
sprite_lights.description: They flitter and flutter in the air, these spritely lights.

troll_bogeys.name: Troll Bogeys
troll_bogeys.description: Like Roman candles but with exploding troll snot.

gnoll_yappers.name: Gnoll Yappers
gnoll_yappers.description: Black cats?? Not these loud yappers.

dragon_bombs.name: Dragon Bombs
dragon_bombs.description: Did you see Lord of the Rings???

dwarven_mortars.name: Dwarven Mortars
dwarven_mortars.description: Dwarf team ready! Here we go....

the_pegasus.name: The Pegasus
the_pegasus.description: Exploding firework that that takes the shape of a flying horse.

tnt.name: TNT
tnt.description: TNT is one of the most commonly used explosives for industrial and mining applications.

nitroglycerin.name: Nitroglycerin
nitroglycerin.description: The main use of nitroglycerin, by tonnage, is in explosives such as dynamite and in propellants.

nitrocellulose.name: Nitrocellulose
nitrocellulose.description: When dry, nitrocellulose is explosive and can be ignited with heat, spark, or friction.

ammonium_nitrate.name: Ammonium Nitrate
ammonium_nitrate.description: Amonium Nitrate is a popular industrial explosive which accounts for 80% of explosives used in North America.

ammonium_picrate.name: Ammonium Picrate
ammonium_picrate.description: Ammonium picrate is a salt formed by reacting picric acid and ammonia. In the TNT family but less stable.

lead_nitrate.name: Lead Nitrate
lead_nitrate.description: Known since the Middle Ages by the name plumb dulcis, the production of lead(II) nitrate from either metallic lead or lead oxide in nitric acid was small-scale, for direct use in making other lead compounds.

tetryl.name: Tetryl
tetryl.description: Tetryl is an explosive compound used to make detonators and explosive booster charges.

pentolite.name: Pentolite
pentolite.description: Civilian pentolite has a detonation velocity of approximately 7,800 metres per second.

aluminium_powder.name: Aluminium Powder
aluminium_powder.description: Aluminium powder is powdered aluminium. This was originally produced by mechanical means using a stamp mill to create flakes.

hmx.name: HMX
hmx.description: Used in the manufacture of missile warheads and armor-piercing shaped charges.

petn.name: PETN
petn.description: Primarily used in booster and bursting charges of small caliber ammunition

rdx.name: RDX
rdx.description: RDX forms the base for a number of common military explosives.

amatol.name: Amatol
amatol.description: Amatol is a highly explosive material made from a mixture of TNT and ammonium nitrate.

brium_nitrate.name: Barium Nitrate
brium_nitrate.description: Barium nitrate's properties make it suitable for use in various military applications, including thermite grenades and incendiary ammunition.

baratol.name: Baratol
baratol.description: Baratol is an explosive made of a mixture of TNT and barium nitrate.

composition_B.name: Composition B
composition_B.description: 'Comp B', is an explosive consisting of castable mixtures of RDX and TNT. It is used as the main explosive filling in artillery projectiles, rockets, land mines, hand grenades and various other munitions.

octol.name: Octol
octol.description: The applications of Octol are generally military; e.g., shaped charges and warheads used in guided missiles and submunitions.

tritonal.name: Tritonal
tritonal.description: Tritonal is a mixture of 80% TNT and 20% aluminium powder, used in several types of ordnance such as air-dropped bombs.
